result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Thomas Trost-Barger

defendant.name: Trost-Barger, Bradley Thomas
defendant.address: 507 S Beaumont Rd # 210, Prairie Du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt:
11:11 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bradley Thomas Trost-Barger appeared by video.  Attorney Tripp Stroud appeared by video for Bradley Thomas Trost-Barger.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Tripp Stroud is heard.   
Defendant is heard. 

Court cancels warrant. 

 Attorney Tripp Stroud is heard on the status of the case. Defendant enters a plea of not guilty. Clerk directed to enter a not guilty plea to each of the counts.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:46 PM Cases 22CM29 & 22TR453 called together - appearances stated. 
Defendant Bradley Thomas Trost-Barger not in court.  Attorney Tripp Stroud appeared by video for Bradley Thomas Trost-Barger.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Questions by court - response by Atty. Stroud
Atty Steiner requests a warrant issue

Court will issue a warrant -with $150.00 bond - will wait one day to sign warrant
Motion for Preservation & Petition for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: The Adjourned Initial Appearance has been moved from 7/5/22 at 10:30 AM to 7/18/22 at 2:30 PM by request of the State Public Defender Office for attorney coverage.  Approved by JA and new notice mailed.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:58 PM Cases 22TR453, 22GF124 and 22CM29 called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Bradley Thomas Trost-Barger in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Steiner states if Def. will be charged in 22GF124 -Def. will be summoned
Court releases Def. from signature bond in 22GF124

Court questions def re: progress in hiring counsel in 22CM29 - Def. believes he will qualify for Public Def., no longer has a job.

Court continues continue once more for def. to obtain counsel
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:32 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bradley Thomas Trost-Barger in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Defendant is given public defender information and paperwork.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Request by Defendant to move his 6/1/22 at 1:30 PM Initial Appearance to 6/6/22 due to work conflict.  No objection to the request by DA Steiner.  JA approved and rescheduled to 6/6/22 at 2:30 PM, in person.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

1:32 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bradley T Trost-Barger appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22GF124 and 22GF125 
Court finds probable cause in 22GF124

State is heard on bond. Recommends a $250.00 cash bond for each case.  (Totaling $500.00 for the two cases) 
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with Dustin Roh.  

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 signature bond on 22GF124. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.   

Court orders a $250.00 cash bond on 22GF125. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
